trans-unit.source: Describes system limits for Azure Backup.
trans-unit.target: Describes system limits for Azure Backup.

trans-unit.source: The following limits apply to Azure Backup.
trans-unit.target: The following limits apply to Azure Backup.

trans-unit.source: Number of servers/machines that can be registered against each vault
trans-unit.target: Number of servers/machines that can be registered against each vault

trans-unit.source: Size of a data source for data stored in Azure vault storage
trans-unit.target: Size of a data source for data stored in Azure vault storage

trans-unit.source: Number of backup vaults that can be created in each Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: Number of backup vaults that can be created in each Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: Number of times backup can be scheduled per day
trans-unit.target: Number of times backup can be scheduled per day

trans-unit.source:
3 per day for Windows Server/Client
2 per day for SCDPM
trans-unit.target:
3 per day for Windows Server/Client
2 per day for SCDPM

trans-unit.source: Number of recovery points that can be created
trans-unit.target: Number of recovery points that can be created

trans-unit.source: Data disks attached to an Azure virtual machine for backup
trans-unit.target: Data disks attached to an Azure virtual machine for backup

trans-unit.source: <sup>1</sup>The 1.65TB limit does not apply to IaaS VM backup.
trans-unit.target: <sup>1</sup>The 1.65TB limit does not apply to IaaS VM backup.

trans-unit.source: <sup>2</sup>You can use any permutation to arrive at a number which is less than 366.
trans-unit.target: <sup>2</sup>You can use any permutation to arrive at a number which is less than 366.
